alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 5:13PM CDT until June 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT/815 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Henry. In southwest Georgia, Clay and Quitman. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT /815 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 PM CDT /613 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lawrenceville, Scottsboro Crossroads, Screamer, Double Bridges, Thomas Mill Creek, Edwin and Coates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
